page.title: 12Thirty Years Of Change Cont.
page.content: Although trains still pass through Kennethmont on their way between the larger centres, the station is now closed. Family size has greatly changed, and where a family with eight or ten children was not unusual thirty years ago, two or three children is now a more likely number. Improved health care means that there is also a great difference in the age of the population with more people living longer. Many pensioners live in Kennethmont, prefering a quiet country retirement to a home in the town or city. Perhaps the biggest change of all is in the attitudes of the people. Our survey suggested that most people thought our society as a whole has become more greedy, lazy, selfish and mercinary than ever before, and that we had lost our self-reliance and now expected too much to be done for us.
